sen.j: 朝倉 景総（あさくら かげふさ 生年不詳 - 永正2年4月4日 (旧暦)（1505年5月7日））は、戦国時代 (日本)初期の武将。
sen.e: Kagefusa ASAKURA (year of birth unknown - May 7, 1505) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the early Sengoku period (Japan).
Kagefusa ASAKURA (year of birth unknown - May 7, 1505) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the beginning of the Sengoku period (Period of Warring States, Japan).
Kagefusa ASAKURA (year of birth unknown - May 7, 1505) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the beginning of the Sengoku period (Period of Warring States, Japan).

sen.j: 朝倉氏家臣。
sen.e: He was a vassal of Asakura clan.
He was a vassal of the Asakura clan.
He was a vassal of the Asakura clan.

sen.j: 孫五郎。
sen.e: He was also called Magogoro.
sen.cmt: 「孫五郎」は読み方不明のため、他姓の孫五郎の読み方(ｵﾝﾗｲﾝ用語集より)で訳しました。
sen.e: He was also called Magogoro.
He was also called Magogoro.

sen.j: 弾正忠。
sen.e: He was also called Danjo-no-chu (a post named "chu" [referring to a judge] in the "Danjo" [referring to the Ministry of Justice]).
He served as Danjo-no-chu (third-grade officer of Danjodai [the Police]).
He served as Danjo-no-chu (third-grade officer of Danjodai [the Police]).

sen.j: 法名大憧宗建。
sen.e: His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) was Daido Soken.
sen.cmt: 「大憧宗建」は読み方不明のため推測で訳しました。法名なので「大憧」が苗字と断定できないため、"Soken DAIDO"とはしていません。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Daisho-soken (or Daido-soken).
His posthumous Buddhist name was Daisho-soken (or Daido-soken).

sen.j: 朝倉孝景 (7代当主)の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh head of the family).
He was the fourth son of Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh head of the family).
He was the fourth son of Takakage ASAKURA (the seventh head of the family).

sen.j: 庶腹の出であったため、兄でありながら常に正妻（桂室永昌）の子である弟の朝倉教景 (以千宗勝)（孝景五男、法名以千宗勝）の下座に置かれた。
sen.e: Although Kagefusa was the elder brother, he was always given the humbler seat than his younger brother, Norikage ASAKURA (the fifth son of Takakage, homyo was Isen Munekatsu) who was the son of Takakage's legal wife (Eisho KEISHITSU), because Kagefusa was the son of a concubine.
sen.cmt: 「以千宗勝」「桂室永昌」は読み方不明のため推測で訳しました。
sen.e: Because Kagefusa was the son of a concubine, he was always given the humbler seat than his brother Norikage ASAKURA (posthumous Buddhist name was Isen-sosho, the fifth son of Takakage) who was the son of Takakage's legal wife (Keishitsu Eisho), although he was older than Norikage.
sen.cmt: 読みを直します。正妻の名「桂室」は苗字ではなく室号、「永昌」は明らかに法名。「なんとか院様」のことは「Nantokain」と訳すルールがありますので、同じ扱いにします。
sen.e: Because Kagefusa was the son of a concubine, he was always given the humbler seat than his brother Norikage ASAKURA (posthumous Buddhist name was Isen-sosho, the fifth son of Takakage) who was the son of Takakage's legal wife (Keishitsu Eisho), although he was older than Norikage.

sen.j: これを恨み、文明 (日本)16年（1484年）7月12日、相撲場で教景を殺害した。
sen.e: Bearing a grudge against this, he killed Norikage in a Sumo hall on July 12, 1484.
Bearing a grudge against that, he killed Norikage in a Sumo ring on July 12, 1484.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Bearing a grudge against that, he killed Norikage in a Sumo ring on July 12, 1484.

sen.j: 教景を養子としていた朝倉光玖は激怒した。
sen.e: Kokyu ASAKURA, who had adopted Norikage, got furious.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kokyu ASAKURA, who had adopted Norikage, got furious.
Kokyu ASAKURA, who had adopted Norikage, got furious.

sen.j: 景総は南条郡の宅良慈眼寺へ逃げ剃髪して許しを請うたという。
sen.e: It is said that Kagefusa escaped to Takura Jigen-ji Temple in Nanjo County and asked for permission by taking the tonsure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that Kagefusa escaped to Takura Jigen-ji Temple in Nanjo County and asked for permission by taking the tonsure.
It is said that Kagefusa escaped to Takura Jigen-ji Temple in Nanjo County and asked for permission by taking the tonsure.

sen.j: その後、光玖の怒りが解けたのか、一乗谷に出仕するようになった。
sen.e: After that he began to serve in Ichijodani, perhaps because Kokyu dispelled his anger.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After that, presumably since Kokyu got over his anger, Kagefusa began to serve in Ichijodani (the Asakura clan's base, Ichijodani Castle).
sen.cmt: 必要な説明を加えます。
sen.e: After that, presumably since Kokyu got over his anger, Kagefusa began to serve in Ichijodani (the Asakura clan's base, Ichijodani Castle).

sen.j: 延徳3年（1491年）の管領細川政元の越後国下向時の見送り役や、明応5年（1496年）の美濃国舟田合戦への派遣軍の大将役などを務めている。
sen.e: He took on the jobs including seeing Kanrei (the shogunal deputy) Masamoto HOSOKAWA going down to Echigo Province in 1491, and being a Taisho (general) of the army dispatched to the Battle of Funada in Mino Province in 1496.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He served as attendant when Kanrei (the shogunal deputy) Masamoto HOSOKAWA went down to Echigo Province in 1491, and as Taisho (general) of the expeditionary army to the Battle of Funada in Mino Province in 1496.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He served as attendant when Kanrei (the shogunal deputy) Masamoto HOSOKAWA went down to Echigo Province in 1491, and as Taisho (general) of the expeditionary army to the Battle of Funada in Mino Province in 1496.

sen.j: また、娘を敦賀郡司家の朝倉景豊に嫁がせている。
sen.e: And he married his daughter to Kagetoyo ASAKURA in Tsuruga Gunji (local magistrates) family.
And he married his daughter off to Kagetoyo ASAKURA from the Gunji family (family serving as Gunji [local magistrates]) of Tsuruga County.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: And he married his daughter off to Kagetoyo ASAKURA from the Gunji family (family serving as Gunji [local magistrates]) of Tsuruga County.

sen.j: しかし、桂室永昌との関係は修復されず、やがて越前国を出奔。
sen.e: However, his relationship with Eisho KEISHITSU was not repaired, and he finally ran away from Echizen Province.
However, he could not improve his relationship with Keishitsu Eisho, and he finally left Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 訳語を統一します。訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: However, he could not improve his relationship with Keishitsu Eisho, and he finally left Echizen Province.

sen.j: その後、京に出て細川政元に仕え、名乗りも朝倉弾正忠元景に替える。
sen.e: After that, he went to Kyoto to serve Masamoto HOSOKAWA, and changed his name to Danjo-no-chu Motokage ASAKURA.
After that, he went to Kyoto to serve Masamoto HOSOKAWA, and changed his name and called himself Danjo-no-chu Motokage ASAKURA.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: After that, he went to Kyoto to serve Masamoto HOSOKAWA, and changed his name and called himself Danjo-no-chu Motokage ASAKURA.

sen.j: 文亀3年（1503年）には朝倉景豊・朝倉宗滴らと共謀し、主家である朝倉貞景 (9代当主)に対する攻撃の計画を企てる。
sen.e: In 1503, he conspired with Kagetoyo ASAKURA, Soteki ASAKURA and so on to plot to attack Sadakage ASAKURA (the ninth head of the family) in the main family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。wikiの元ページでは、最初の「朝倉宗滴」が「朝倉教景（朝倉宗滴）」になっていますが、ここではB列の記載通り訳しました。
sen.e: In 1503, he conspired with Kagetoyo ASAKURA, Soteki ASAKURA and others to attack their master Sadakage ASAKURA (the ninth head of the family).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、二重訳があります。「主家」は登録どおりmasterが正しいです。
sen.e: In 1503, he conspired with Kagetoyo ASAKURA, Soteki ASAKURA and others to attack their master Sadakage ASAKURA (the ninth head of the family).

sen.j: だが、教景（宗滴）の密告で計画が漏洩。
sen.e: But the plan was leaked out by anonymous information from Norikage (Soteki).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However the plot was leaked out since Norikage (Soteki) informed secretly.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「密告」は必ずしも匿名ではありません。
sen.e: However the plot was leaked out since Norikage (Soteki) informed secretly.

sen.j: 景豊は貞景に本拠の敦賀を攻められ自刃。
sen.e: Kagetoyo suicided by the sword after Sadakage attacked Tsuruga, the headquarter of Kagetoyo.
Kagetoyo committed suicide with his sword after his base Tsuruga was attacked by Sadakage.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Kagetoyo committed suicide with his sword after his base Tsuruga was attacked by Sadakage.

sen.j: 近江国から出兵していた景総はこの報を聞き退却。
sen.e: Kagefusa, who had come to war from Omi Province, retreated when he heard the news.
Although Kagefusa had already moved his army from Omi Province, receiving the news, he retreated.
Although Kagefusa had already moved his army from Omi Province, receiving the news, he retreated.

sen.j: その後、美濃・飛騨を経て加賀国に入った。
sen.e: Then he went into Kaga Province via Mino Province and Hida Province.
Then he went into Kaga Province via Mino Province and Hida Province.
Then he went into Kaga Province via Mino Province and Hida Province.

sen.j: 景総は加賀で反朝倉の兵を募った。
sen.e: Kagefusa recruited soldiers in Kaga Province to cope with ASAKURA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kagefusa recruited soldiers in Kaga Province to revolt against the Asakura family (his ex-master, Asakura).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Kagefusa recruited soldiers in Kaga Province to revolt against the Asakura family (his ex-master, Asakura).

sen.j: 景総は、翌永正元年（1504年）8月、越前国坪江に出陣し、貞景に決戦を挑むが敗れ能登国に逃亡。
sen.e: In August, 1504 (the next year), his troops went to Tsuboe in Echizen Province to fight against Sadakage, but he lost and escaped to Noto Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In August, 1504 (the next year), Kagefusa led his army to Tsuboe in Echizen Province and challenged Sadakage to fight the decisive battle, however he lost and ran away to Noto Province.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In August, 1504 (the next year), Kagefusa led his army to Tsuboe in Echizen Province and challenged Sadakage to fight the decisive battle, however he lost and ran away to Noto Province.

sen.j: 永正2年（1505年）4月4日、能登春木の斎藤館で病死した。
sen.e: On April 4, 1505, he died of an illness in Saito-yakata Mansion in Haruki, Noto Province.
On April 4, 1505, he died of an illness in Saito-yakata Mansion in Haruki, Noto Province.
On April 4, 1505, he died of an illness in Saito-yakata Mansion in Haruki, Noto Province.

sen.j: 余六、地蔵院という二人の男児がいたようである。
sen.e: It seemed that he had two sons named Yoroku and Jizo-in.
Presumably he had two sons who were called Yoroku and Jizoin.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Presumably he had two sons who were called Yoroku and Jizoin.
